Package sammish93.tbage

Class GameSettings

java.lang.Object
sammish93.tbage.GameSettings
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class GameSettings extends Object implements Serializable
A class intended to hold preferences and settings stipulating how the game renders.
See Also:

    • getFontOutput

      public Font getFontOutput()
      Returns:
      Returns a Font object representing the font size, style, and font face used by the output text area when the game is run using Java Swing.

    • setFontOutput

      public void setFontOutput(Font font)
      Parameters:
      font - Sets a Font object to represent the font size, style, and font face used by the output text area when the game is run using Java Swing.

    • getFontInput

      public Font getFontInput()
      Returns:
      Returns a Font object representing the font size, style, and font face used by the input text field when the game is run using Java Swing.

    • setFontInput

      public void setFontInput(Font font)
      Parameters:
      font - Sets a Font object to represent the font size, style, and font face used by the input text field ame is run using Java Swing.

    • getFontGeneral

      public Font getFontGeneral()
      Returns:
      Returns a Font object representing the font size, style, and font face used by the interface buttons and labels when the game is run using Java Swing.

    • setFontGeneral

      public void setFontGeneral(Font font)
      Parameters:
      font - Sets a Font object to represent the font size, style, and font face used by the interface buttons and labels when the game is run using Java Swing.

    • isFontAnimated

      public boolean isFontAnimated()
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value representing if the font is printed to the output (either terminal window or Swing text area) with or without a delay after each character.

    • setFontAnimated

      public void setFontAnimated(boolean fontAnimated)
      Parameters:
      fontAnimated - Sets the boolean value to represent if the font is printed to the output (either the terminal window or Swing text area) with or without a delay after each character.

    • getFontAnimationSpeed

      public int getFontAnimationSpeed()
      Returns:
      Returns a positive integer value representing the pause (in milliseconds) between each character being printed to the output (either the terminal window or Swing text area).

    • setFontAnimationSpeed

      public void setFontAnimationSpeed(int fontAnimationSpeed) throws InvalidValueException
      Parameters:
      fontAnimationSpeed - Sets a positive integer value to represent the pause (in milliseconds) between each character being printed to the output (either the terminal window or Swing text area). NOTE: In the case that a value of 0 is provided then font animation will be turned off.
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - Thrown when a negative integer value is provided.

    • isOutputSeparatedByNewLine

      public boolean isOutputSeparatedByNewLine()
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value representing if each line printed to the output (either the terminal window or Swing text area) is separated by a new line or not.

    • setOutputSeparatedByNewLine

      public void setOutputSeparatedByNewLine(boolean outputSeparatedByNewLine)
      Parameters:
      outputSeparatedByNewLine - Sets a boolean value to represent if each line printed to the output (either the terminal window * or Swing text area) is separated by a new line or not.

    • getWindowResolution

      public int[] getWindowResolution()
      Returns:
      Returns an int array with 2 values. The value at index 0 is the width, and the value at index 1 is the height.

    • setWindowResolution

      public void setWindowResolution(int windowWidth, int windowHeight)
      Parameters:
      windowWidth - A positive integer used to provide the Java Swing interface with a width (in pixels).
      windowHeight - A positive integer used to provide the Java Swing interface with a height (in pixels).

    • setFullscreen

      public void setFullscreen(boolean isFullscreen)
      Parameters:
      isFullscreen - A boolean value used set whether the Java Swing interface launches in full screen.

    • isFullscreen

      public boolean isFullscreen()
      Returns:
      Returns a boolean value representing whether the Java Swing interface launches in full screen.

    • getWindowTitle

      public String getWindowTitle()
      Returns:
      Returns a string of the title of the game. The title will appear on the top of the window if the game is run in a Java Swing window.

    • setWindowTitle

      public void setWindowTitle(String windowTitle)
      Parameters:
      windowTitle - Sets a string for the title of the game. The title will appear on the top of the window if the game is run in a Java Swing window.

    • save

      public void save(String path) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: gameSettings.save("src/fileName");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • save

      public void save(String path, String fileExtension) throws IOException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is decided by the developer.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the .ser file will be saved to, along with the file name. Example: gameSettings.save("src/fileName", "sav");
      fileExtension - The file type extension the developer wishes to save the file as.
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      InvalidPathException - Arises if the path contains characters other than the English alphabet, underscores, and forward slashes.

    • load

      public static GameSettings load(String path) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Serialises to a local path. The file type extension is only required when the extension is something other than '.ser'.
      Parameters:
      path - The location that the file is located at. This can either be with or without the file extension. Examples: var gameSettings = GameSettings.save("src/fileNameWithSavExtension.sav"); or var gameSettings = GameSettings.save("src/fileNameWithSerExtension");
      Throws:
      IOException - Arises if the file path cannot be serialised to.
      ClassNotFoundException - Arises if the file cannot be deserialised to this class. underscores, and forward slashes.
